summary: Interactive romantic-themed Valentine web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with Yes/No prompt; No button evades hover/click, and Yes shows a 'Good choice' meme image; designed to run easily on iPad Chrome.
architectural_notes: Single-file or static HTML/CSS/JS page intended to run locally in Chrome on iPad.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page, romantic-themed Valentine prompt UI that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" with two prominent options: "Yes" and "No".
Implement interactive behavior for the "No" option so it moves away when the user attempts to interact with it (hover on desktop; pointer/touch interaction on iPad) such that it cannot be clicked.
When the user clicks "Yes", replace the prompt UI with a celebratory view that displays a meme image containing the text: "Good choice".

Apply a cohesive romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme, including typography and decorative styling that feels romantic while keeping the page simple and focused on the single Valentine prompt purpose.
Add the required generated image(s) to the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them directly from the frontend (do not serve images from the backend).
Ensure the page works well on iPad Chrome, including responsive layout, large tap targets, and interaction logic that does not rely solely on mouse hover.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a simple romantic-themed Valentine prompt web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with pink/white styling for iPad Chrome
Implement Yes/No options where the No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking
On Yes click, display a meme image with the text 'Good choice'

projectName: Romantic Valentine single-page prompt with evasive No button and Yes meme reveal
